snippet: Eastman Kodak is seeking to set up a confidential auction for its portfolio of over 1,100 patents, after the bankrupt film pioneer acknowledged that it had encountered difficulty drawing a lead bidder.
abstract: Eastman Kodak is seeking to set up a confidential auction for its portfolio of over 1,100 patents, after the bankrupt film pioneer acknowledged that it had encountered difficulty drawing a lead bidder.

headline.main: Kodak Concedes Difficulty in Drawing Lead Bidder for Patents

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

snippet: How Angus King, Maine’s fierce independent streak and the memory of Joshua Chamberlain may affect the shape of the Senate next year.
abstract: How Angus King, Maine’s fierce independent streak and the memory of Joshua Chamberlain may affect the shape of the Senate next year.

snippet: What Apple's cooperation with automakers means for in-car electronics systems.
abstract: What Apple's cooperation with automakers means for in-car electronics systems.

headline.print_headline: Apple and Siri In Driver’s Seat

snippet: During its presentation on Monday, Apple highlighted features that it made just for China. It shows just how important that market has become for the company.
abstract: During its presentation on Monday, Apple highlighted features that it made just for China. It shows just how important that market has become for the company.

snippet: During Monday's Apple developer conference, Tim Cook, Apple's chief executive, was no longer compared to Steven P. Jobs, the co-founder of Apple, who often commanded an Apple keynote as a rock star. But Mr. Cook had control and command, so much so...
abstract: During Monday's Apple developer conference, Tim Cook, Apple's chief executive, was no longer compared to Steven P. Jobs, the co-founder of Apple, who often commanded an Apple keynote as a rock star. But Mr. Cook had control and command, so much so that it went unremarked upon.

headline.main: At Apple Keynote, Talk Is of Products, Not Steve Jobs or Tim Cook

snippet: David Pogue learned a lot at the Apple Worldwide Developers' Conference presentation Monday. He lays it all out here, including news about Airport Express and two photo programs.
abstract: David Pogue learned a lot at the Apple Worldwide Developers' Conference presentation Monday. He lays it all out here, including news about Airport Express and two photo programs.

headline.main: An Explanation of the News From Apple

snippet: Apple now has 400 million active accounts in iTunes with credit cards. That means that all of Apple's iOS devices are linked to those credit cards, too, challenging Google Wallet and others in the race to become a smartphone payment method.
abstract: Apple now has 400 million active accounts in iTunes with credit cards. That means that all of Apple's iOS devices are linked to those credit cards, too, challenging Google Wallet and others in the race to become a smartphone payment method.

headline.main: Apple's Stash of Credit Card Numbers Is Its Secret Weapon

snippet: Apple's new releases are usually sold for their effect on consumers and educators. With iPhones and iPads increasingly making their way into offices, however, and cloud computing blurring the line between work and home, Apple is becoming an enterp...
abstract: Apple's new releases are usually sold for their effect on consumers and educators. With iPhones and iPads increasingly making their way into offices, however, and cloud computing blurring the line between work and home, Apple is becoming an enterprise device company, too. Some of the new features show how.

headline.main: Apple Steps Further Into the Business Market

snippet: A new feature on the iPhone moves Apple closer to the mobile wallet business by storing digital payment options and loyalty cards in one handy application.
abstract: A new feature on the iPhone moves Apple closer to the mobile wallet business by storing digital payment options and loyalty cards in one handy application.

headline.main: Apple Puts Your Wallet in the iPhone

snippet: The company’s high-end laptop computer, the MacBook Pro, will have a high-resolution “retina display” like the one on the screens of new iPads and iPhones.
abstract: Apple introduces a new version of its mobile operating system for iPhones and iPads that brings a host of new features; system updates its ultralight MacBook Air laptop and its high-end MacBook Pro.

headline.main: Apple Updates Laptops and Mobile Software
headline.print_headline: Apple Updates Laptops And Mobile Software

byline.original: By BRIAN X. CHEN and NICK WINGFIELD
